title: Engraved font used for a wedding invitation circa 1945 - 1950's
content:
I used this font for my wedding invitation in 1973. I had my local printer track it down from an invitation I had borrowed from an older friend. Unfortunately, I did not write the name of the font down and it is driving me crazy.

Can anyone ID this font? Sorry about the pixelation, but the scan I did years ago was not very good and I can't find the original at this time.

Thanks,  
Rebecca

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101227155745im_/http:/typophile.com/files/rebecca4_4006.JPG)
author: adamsrbk

comments.content:
Well I don't know what this is exactly but you try...

[http://www.virusfonts.com/spec%20sheets/tourette.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20101227155745/http:/www.virusfonts.com/spec%20sheets/tourette.html "http://www.virusfonts.com/spec%20sheets/tourette.html")

browse fonts by Nick Curtis

[http://www.nicksfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20101227155745/http:/www.nicksfonts.com/ "http://www.nicksfonts.com")

or Letterhead Fonts

[http://letterheadfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20101227155745/http:/letterheadfonts.com/ "http://letterheadfonts.com")

But I'm sure one of the freaks here will have the exact answer for you... (I mean freaks in loving way)

Mikey :-)

Rebecca A Smith

Thanks for the suggestions; I checked them out and nothing found so far. I will try to find the original and re scan for a better image.

I understand the freaks comments, although I am not as adicted as some, I do enjoy the varieties and the challenge.

Rebecca
